intro: Veratrum maackii subsp. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its bulbs contain toxic alkaloids, making it potentially hazardous to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
